meanings.definition: A large marine crustacean with a hard shell, long antennae, and claws.
meanings.sent1: The lobsters scuttled along the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed a delicious lobster dinner by the beach.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lobsters throw a party? Because they wanted to shell-ebrate!
meanings.sent4: The lobsters in the tank looked like armored warriors ready for battle.
meanings.sent5: The bright red lobsters stood out against the sandy seabed.

meanings.definition: To catch or try to catch lobsters.
meanings.sent1: We decided to go lobsters hunting near the rocky shore.
meanings.sent2: He lobsters for a living, bringing in fresh catches every day.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lobster blush? Because it saw the seafood dressing!
meanings.sent4: She lobsters with precision, never missing a chance to catch one.
meanings.sent5: The fishermen set out early in the morning to lobsters in the deep waters.
